verbs.description: resurface (third-person singular simple present resurfaces, present participle resurfacing, simple past and past participle resurfaced)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To come once again to the surface
examples: His body finally resurfaced after three years underwater.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To provide a new surface, to replace or remodel the surface of something, or to restore a surface. To put a new coating or finish on a surface.
examples: A zamboni is a big machine that resurfaces ice at a rink so it is smooth as glass for the skaters.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To arise or become evident again. To re-occur or reappear.
(of a person) To come out of hiding or obscurity.
(of a person) To be seen or found alive after being a missing person for some time.
